sentence: The paper proposes a neural net implementation of counterfactual regret minimization where 2 networks are learnt, one for estimating the cumulative regret (used to derive the immediate policy) and the other one for estimating a cumulative mixture policy.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: In addition the authors also propose an original MC sampling strategy which generalize outcome and external sampling strategies.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper is interesting and easy to read. My main concern is about the feasibility of using a neural networks to learn cumulative quantities.
label: none

sentence: The problem of learning cumulative quantities in a neural net is that we need two types of samples:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - the positive examples: samples from which we train our network to predict its own value plus the new quantity,
label: none

sentence: but also:
label: none

sentence: - the negative examples: samples from which we should train the network to predict 0, or any desired initial value.
label: none

sentence: However in the approach proposed here, the negative examples are missing.
label: none

sentence: So the network is not trained to predict 0 (or any initial values) for a newly encountered state.
label: none

sentence: And since neural networks generalize (very well...) to states that have not been sampled yet, the network would predict an arbitrary values in states that are visited for the first time.
label: none

sentence: For example the network predicting the cumulative regret may generalize to large values at newly visited states, instead of predicting a value close to 0.
label: none

sentence: The resulting policy can be arbitrarily different from an exploratory (close to uniform) policy, which would be required to minimize regret from a newly visited state.
label: none

sentence: Then, even if that state is visited frequently in the future, this error in prediction will never be corrected because the target cumulative regret depends on the previous prediction.
label: none

sentence: So there is no guarantee this algorithm will minimise the overall regret.
label: none

sentence: This is a well known problem for exploration (regret minimization) in reinforcement learning as well (see e.g. the work on pseudo-counts [Bellemare et al., 2016, Unifying Count-Based Exploration and Intrinsic Motivation] as one possible approach based on learning a density model).
label: none

sentence: Here, maybe a way to alleviate this problem would be to generate negative samples (where the network would be trained to predict low cumulative values) by following a different (possibly more exploratory) policy.
label: none

sentence: Other comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - It does not seem necessary to predict cumulative mixture policies (ASN network).
label: none

sentence: One could train a mixture policy network to directly predict the current policy along trajectories generated by MC.
label: none

sentence: Since the samples would be generated according to the current policy \sigma_t, any information nodes I_i would be sampled proportionally to \pi^{\sigma^t}_i(I_i), which is the same probability as in the definition of the mixture policy (4).
label: none

sentence: This would remove the need to learn a cumulative quantity.
label: none

sentence: - It would help to have a discussion about how to implement (7), for example do you use a target network to keep the target value R_t+r_t fixed for several steps?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: - It is not clear how the initialisation (10) is implemented.
label: none

sentence: Since you assume the number of information nodes is large, you cannot minimize the l2 loss over all states. Do you assume you generate states by following some policy? Which policy?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Pros
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Solid technical innovation/contribution:
label: none

sentence: - The paper proposed a novel method FICM that bridged the intrinsic reward in DRL with optical flow loss in CV to encourage exploration in an environment with sparse rewards.
label: none

sentence: To the best of my knowledge, this was the first paper proposed to use moving patterns in two consecutive observations to motivate agent exploration.
label: none

sentence: Balanced view:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The authors discussed both the advantages of FICM and settings that FICM might fail to perform well, and conducted experiments to better help the readers understand such nuances.
label: none

sentence: Such balanced view should be valuable to RL communities in both academia and industry.
label: none

sentence: Clarity:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - In general this was a very well-written paper, I had no difficulty in following the paper throughout.
label: none

sentence: The proposed method (FICM) was clearly motivated, and the authors provided good coverage of related works.
label: none

sentence: Notably, the authors reviewed two relevant methods upon which FICM was motivated, which made the paper self-contained.
label: none

sentence: Cons
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Experiments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Experiments were conducted only using a few recent results as baselines (ICM, forward dynamics, RND).
label: none

sentence: It would be interesting to compare FICM against simpler exploration baselines such as epsilon-greedy or entropy regularization.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - I’d also like to see more extensive comparisons between FICM and ICM across different datasets, for example, Super Mario Bros. and the Atari games, instead of only comparing FICM against ICM on ViZDoom.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Significance of the innovation:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The proposed exploration method seemed to be applicable with a particular RL setting: the environment changes could be represented through consecutive frames (e.g., video games), and optical flow could be used to interpret any object displacements in such consecutive frames.
label: none

sentence: And as the authors discussed, even under such constraints the applicability of proposed method depends on how much changes of the environment were relevant to the goal.
label: none

sentence: Reproducibility:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Although the authors discussed the experiment setting in detail in supplements, I believe open-sourcing the code / software used to conduct the experiments would be greatly help with the reproducibility of the proposed method for researchers or practitioners.
label: none

sentence: Summary
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: A good paper overall, but the experiments were relatively weak (common for most ICLR submissions) and the novelty was somewhat limited.
label: none

sentence: The submission proposes a new method for agent design to learn about the behaviour of other fixed agents inhabiting the same environment.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The method builds on imitation learning (behavioural cloning) to model the agent’s behaviour and reinforcement learning to learn a probing policy to more broadly explore different target agent behaviours.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Overall, the approach falls into the field of intrinsic motivation / curiosity-like reward generation procedures but with respect to target agent behaviour instead of the agent’s environment.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: While learning to model the target agent’s inner state, the RL reward is generated based on the difference of the target agent’s inner state between consecutive time steps.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The approach is evaluated against a small set of baselines in various toy grid-world scenarios and a sorting task and overall performs commensurate or better than the investigated baselines.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Given its limitation to small and low-dimensional environments, it cannot be said how well the approach will scale with respect to these factors and the resulting, more complex agent behaviours.
label: none

sentence: It would be highly beneficial to evaluate these aspects.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Furthermore, it would be beneficial to provide more information about the baselines; in particular the type of count-based exploration.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: For the generated figures, it would be beneficial to include standard deviation and mean over multiple runs to not only evaluate performance but also robustness.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Overall, while the agent behaviour modelling focused on a type of inner state (based on past trajectories) provides benefits in the evaluated examples, it is unsure how well the approach scales to more complex domains based on strong similarity and simplicity of the tested toy scenarios (evaluation on sorting problems is an interesting step towards to address this shortcoming).
label: none

sentence: One additional aspect pointing towards the necessity of further evaluation is the strong dependence of performance on the dimensionality of the latent, internal state (Fig.4).
label: none

sentence: Minor issues:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Reward formulations for the baselines as part of the appendix.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: - Same scale for the y-axes across figures
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: This paper proposes a pair of LSTM networks, one of which estimates the current strategy at iteration t+1 and the other estimates the average strategy after t iterations.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: By using these networks within a CFR framework, the authors manage to avoid huge memory requirements traditionally needed to save cumulative regret and average strategy values for all information sets across many iterations.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The neural networks are trained via a novel sampling method with lower variance/memory-requirements that outcome/external sampling, and are amendable to continual improvement by warm-starting the networks based on cloned tabular regret values.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Overall, the paper is well-written with clear definitions/explanations plus  comprehensive ablation-analyses throughout, and thus constitutes a nice addition to the recent literature on leveraging neural networks for IIG.
label: none

sentence: I did not find many flaws to point out, except I believe the paper could benefit from more extensive  comparisons in Figure 4A against other IIG methods such as Deep Stack, as well as comparing on much larger IIG settings with many more states to see how the neural CFR methods hold up in the regime where they are most needed.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Typo:  "care algorithm design" -> "careful algorithm design"
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: The paper proposes a new way to generate adversarial images that are perturbed based on natural images called Shadow Attach.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The generated adversarial images are imperceptible and have a large norm to escape the certification regions.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The proposed method incorporates the quantities of total variation of the perturbation, change in the mean of each color channel, and dissimilarity between channels, into the loss function, to make sure the generate adversarial images are smooth and natural.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Quantitative studies on CIFAR-10 and ImageNet shows that the new attack method can generate adversarial images that have larger certified radii than natural images.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: To further improve the paper, it would be great if the authors can address the following questions:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - In Table 1, for ImageNet, Shadow Attach does not always generate adversarial examples that have on average larger certified radii than the natural parallel, at least for sigma=0.5 and 1.0. Could the authors explain the reason?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - In Table 2, it is not clear to me what is the point for comparing errors of the natural images (which measures the misclassification rate of a natural image) and that of the adversarial images (which measures successful attacks rate), and why this comparison helps to support the claim that the attack results in a stronger certificates.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: In my opinion, to support the above claim, shouldn’t the authors provide a similar table as Table 1, directly comparing the certified radii of the natural images and adversarial images?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - From Figure 9, we see the certificate radii of the natural have at least two peaks. Though on average the certificate radii of the adversarial attacks is higher than that of the natural images, it is smaller than the right peak. Could the authors elaborate more of the results?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - Sim(delta) should be Dissim(delta) which measures the dissimilarity between channels.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: A smaller dissimilarity suggests a greater similarity between channels.
label: none

sentence: - Lambda sim and lambda s are used interchangeably. Please make it consistent.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: - The caption of Table 1 is a little vague. Please clearly state the meaning of the numbers in the table.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: The paper proposes a new joint learning algorithm that works for two tasks, NER and RE.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The model is based on a pre-trained BERT model, which provides the word vectors of the input word sequence.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Then it solves two tasks with two network branches: the first branch minimizes the loss for NER, and the second branch minimizes the loss for RE.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The second branch uses entity labels predicted by the first branch, so joint learning may benefit both tasks.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The design of the architecture is novel, but it is also not groundbreaking.
label: none

sentence: Each network branch is from known structures, but the combination is not proposed before.
label: none

sentence: The submission has evaluated the proposed algorithms on four datasets and improved SOTA performances.
label: none

sentence: The ablation study justifies the design details.
label: none

sentence: The writing is generally clear.
label: none

sentence: This papers tackles the following question. Is it possible to learn the "most" complex instance of a class of (combinatorial) problem while finding (or recovering) algorithms with strong minimax rate.

sentence: This is very interesting and clearly a nice line of work (in theory though).

sentence: The techniques used rely on GANs since it can be shown that finding the best (random) algorithm and the worst (deterministic) instance is equivalent to finding the worst random instance against the best deterministic algorithm.

sentence: This is actually a direct consequence of any minmax theorem in game theory; the authors decided to credit that result to Yao (I tend to *strongly* disagree with that point as, even if he stated this fact in CS, this result was quite standard several decades before him - anyway.).

sentence: So at the end, I am a bit puzzled. I really like the idea, but I have the feeling that this technique should have been developed for more complicated setting. Or maybe it is actually not working on more difficult combinatorial problem (and this is hidden in the paper).

sentence: Summary:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This paper proposes a way to train a manager agent which would manage a bunch of worker agents to achieve a high-level goal.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Each worker has its own set of skills and preferences and the manager tries to assign sub-tasks to these agents along with bonuses such that the agents can even perform tasks that are not preferred by them.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Authors achieve this by training a manager which tracks the skills and preferences of the agents on the fly.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Authors have done an extensive analysis of the proposed approach in two simple domains: resource collection and crafting.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Major comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This paper focuses on multi-agent settings with self-interested agents.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The problem formulation and the solution are novel enough.
label: none

sentence: Experiments are on toy domains with very few goals and sub-task dependencies.
label: none

sentence: However, authors have done a good job in doing an extensive analysis of the proposed approach.
label: none

sentence: 1.	Can you comment about the scalability of the proposed solution when the number of possible subtasks increases? When the sub-task dependency graph size increases?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 2.	What is the reason for using rule-based agents in all the experiments? It would have been more useful if all the analysis are done with RL agents rather than rule-based agents.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: It would also make the paper stronger.
label: none

sentence: 3.	Are the authors willing to release the code? Overall the model looks complicated and the appendix is not sufficient to reproduce the results in the paper.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: I would increase my rating if the authors are willing to release the code to reproduce all the results reported in the paper.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Minor comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1.	Page 3, line 9: “typical” -> “typically”
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: 2.	Page 3, “intention” section: “Based on the its reward ..” Check grammar.
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: 3.	Page 5, last line: “the total quantitative is 10” check grammar.
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: 4.	Page 8, conclusions, second line: “nad” -> “and”
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: 5.	Page 8, conclusions, 4th line: “combing” -> “combine”
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: The authors proposed an AutoLoss controller that can learn to take actions of updating different parameters and using different loss functions.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Pros
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. Propose a unified framework for different loss objectives and parameters.
label: none

sentence: 2. An interesting idea in meta learning for learning loss objectives/schedule.
label: none

sentence: Cons:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. The formulation uses REINFORCE, which is often known with high variance.
label: none

sentence: Are the results averaged across different runs? Can you show the variance?
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: It is hard to understand the results without discussing it.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: The sample complexity should be also higher than traditional approaches.
label: none

sentence: 2. It is hard to understand what the model has learned compared to hand-crafted schedule. Are there any analysis other than the results alone?
label: arg-request_result

sentence: 3. Why do you set S=1 in the experiments? What’s the importance of S?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 4. I think it is quite surprising the AutoLoss can resolve mode collapse in GANs.
label: none

sentence: I think more analysis is needed to support this claim.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 5. The evaluation metric of multi-task MT is quite weird. Normally people report BLEU, whereas the authors use PPL.
label: none

sentence: 6. According to https://github.com/pfnet-research/chainer-gan-lib, I think the bested reported DCGAN results is not 6.16 on CIFAR-10 and people still found other tricks such as spectral-norm is needed to prevent mode-collapse.
label: none

sentence: Minor:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. The usage of footnote 2 is incorrect.
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: 2. In references, some words should be capitalized properly such as gan->GAN.
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: Summary: This paper uses visual representation learned over monolingual corpora with image annotations, which overcomes the lack of large-scale bilingual sentence-image pairs for multimodal NMT.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Their approach enables visual information to be integrated into large-scale text-only NMT.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Experiments on four widely used translation datasets show that the proposed approach achieves significant improvements over strong baselines.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Strengths:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - This paper is well motivated and well written. I especially like how they use external paired sentence-image data from Multi30k to learn weak pairs for sentences in machine translation.
label: none

sentence: - Experimental results are convincing. I like how low-resource translation is included as a priority in their experiments.
label: none

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Do you have any explanations as to why the number of images, if too large, actually hurts translation performance? Is it because more images also leads to a higher chance of noisy images?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - It would be nice to have an experiment that varies the size of the external paired sentence-image dataset and tested the impact on performance.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - Please comment on the extra computation required for obtaining image data for MT sentences and for learning image representations.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - Why are there missing BLEU scores and the number of parameters in Table 1?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: ### Post rebuttal
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Thank you for your detailed answers to my questions.
label: none

sentence: The paper is well written and the main contribution, a methodology to find “blind-spot attacks” well motivated and differences to prior work stated clearly.
label: none

sentence: The empirical results presented in Figure 1 and 2 are very convincing.
label: none

sentence: The gain of using a sufficiently more complicated approach to assess the overall distance between the test and training dataset is not clear, comparing it to the very insightful histograms.
label: none

sentence: Why for example not using a simple score based on the histogram, or even the mean distance?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: Of course providing a single measure would allow to leverage that information during training.
label: none

sentence: However, in its current form this seems rather complicated and computationally expensive (KL-based).
label: none

sentence: As stated later in the paper the histograms themselves are not informative enough to detect such blind-spot transformation.
label: none

sentence: Intuitively this makes a lot of sense given that the distance is based on the network embedding and is therefore also susceptible to this kind of data.
label: none

sentence: However, it is not further discussed how the overall KL-based data similarity measure would help in this case since it seems likely that it would also exhibit the same issue.
label: none

sentence: The paper considers an actor-critic scheme for multiagent RL, where the critic is specific to each agent and has access to all other agents' embedded observations.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The main idea is to use an attention mechanism in the critic that learns to selectively scale the contributions of the other agents.
label: none

sentence: The paper presents sufficient motivation and background, and the proposed algorithmic implementation seems reasonable.
label: none

sentence: The proposed scheme is compared to two recent algorithms for centralized training of decentralized policies, and shows comparable or better results on two synthetic multiagent problems.
label: none

sentence: I believe that the idea and approach of the paper are interesting and contribute to the multiagent learning literature.
label: none

sentence: Regarding cons:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The critical structural choices (such as the attention model in section 3.2) are presented without too much justification, discussion of alternatives, etc.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - The experiments show the learning results, but do not provide a peak "under the hood" to understand the way attention evolved and contributed to the results.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - The experiments show good results compared to existing algorithms, but not impressively so.
label: none

sentence: This paper suggests a quantization approach for neural networks, based on the Product Quantization (PQ) algorithm which has been successful in quantization for similarity search.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The basic idea is to quantize the weights of a neuron/single layer with a variant of PQ, which is modified to optimize the quantization error of inner products of sample inputs with the weights, rather than the weights themselves.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This is cast as a weighted variant of k-means.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The inner product is more directly related to the network output (though still does not account for non-linear neuron activations) and thus is expected to yield better downstream performance, and only requires introducing unlabeled input samples into the quantization process.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This approach is built into a pipeline that gradually quantizes the entire network.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Overall, I support the paper and recommend acceptance.
label: none

sentence: PQ is known to be successful for quantization in other contexts, and the specialization suggested here for neural networks is natural and well-motivated.
label: none

sentence: The method can be expected to perform well empirically, which the experiments verify, and to have potential impact.
label: none

sentence: Questions:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. Can you comment on the quantization time of the suggested method? Repeatedly solving the EM steps can add up to quite an overhead.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Does it pose a difficulty? How does it compare to other methods?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 2. Can you elaborate on the issue of non-linearity? It is mentioned only briefly in the conclusion. What is the difficulty in incorporating it? Is it in solving equation (4)? And perhaps, how do you expect it to effect the results?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: This paper combines the global and local stability prediction and tries to get interpretable results using the stethoscope design, which is actually a weighted subbranch for the main branch.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: There are several concerns regarding the proposed framework.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1) How to choose \lambda?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: A better design could be a learnable \lambda.
label: none

sentence: Instead of just one scalar value, it could be better to learn a map of \lambdas, which indicates the distribution of local stability and how it is related to global stability.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: The visualization of the \lambda map might be more interpretable for understanding the stability prediction.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: 2) The global stability prediction does not have a consistent correlation with the local stability prediction, as shown by the easy and hard examples.
label: none

sentence: This complex relationship will confuse the network during the training.
label: none

sentence: That is, the current design hasn't well considered the local and global stability relation, but just simply sum them up.
label: none

sentence: This is hard to provide a meaningful interpretation of the task.
label: none

sentence: This paper provides an approach to use visual information to improve text only neural machine translation systems.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The approach creates a "topic word to images" map using an existing image aligned translation corpora.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Given a source sentence, the model extracts relevant images, extracts their Resnet features and fuses them with the features generated from the word sequence.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The decoder uses these fused representation to generate the target sentence.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Overall, I like the approach, seems like it can be easily augmented to existing NMT systems.
label: none

sentence: One of the claims of the paper was to be able to use monolingual image aligned data.
label: none

sentence: However image captioning datasets are not mentioned.
label: none

sentence: It would make sense to use image captioning data to create the image lookup.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Also, what will be the performance of a standard image captioning system on the task ?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: I believe it will not be great, but I think for completeness, you should add such a baseline.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Minor comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. What is M in Algorithm 1 ?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 2. First paragraph in related work is very unrelated to the current subject, please remove.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Gradient-free evolutionary search methods for Reinforcement Learning are typically very stable, but scale poorly with the number of parameters when optimizing highly-parametrized policies (e.g. neural networks).
label: none

sentence: Meanwhile, gradient-based deep RL methods, such as DDPG are often sample efficient, particularly in the off-policy setting when, unlike evolutionary search methods, they can continue to use previous experience to estimate values.
label: none

sentence: However, these approaches can also be unstable.
label: none

sentence: This work combines the well-known CEM search with TD3 (an improved variant of DDPG).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The key idea of of this work is in each generation of CEM, 1/2 the individuals are improved using TD3 (i.e. the RL gradient).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This method is made more practical by using a replay buffer so experience from previous generations is used for the TD3 updates and importance sampling is used to improve the efficiency of CEM.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This work shows, on some simple control tasks, that this method appears to result in much stronger performance compared with CEM, and small improvements over TD3 alone.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: It also typically out-performs ERL.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Intuitively, it seems like it may be possible to construct counter-examples where the gradient updates will prevent convergence.
label: none

sentence: Issues of convergence seem like they deserve some discussion here and potentially could be examined empirically (is CEM-TD3 converging in the swimmer?).
label: none

sentence: The justification that the method of Khadka & Tumer (2018) cannot be extended to use CEM, since the RL policies do not comply with the covariance matrix is unclear to me.
label: none

sentence: Algorithm 1, step 20, the covariance matrix is updated after the RL step so regardless of how the RL policies are generated, the search distribution on the next distribution includes them.
label: none

sentence: In both this work, and Khadka & Tumer, the RL updates lead to policies that differ from the search distribution (indeed that is the point), and there is no guarantee in this work that the TD3 updates result in policies close to the starting point.
label: none

sentence: It sees like the more important distinction is that, in this approach, the information flows both from ES to RL and vice-versa, rather than just from RL to ES.
label: none

sentence: One view of this method would be that it is an ensemble method for learning the policy [e.g. similar to Osband et al., 2016 for DQN].
label: none

sentence: This could be discussed and a relevant control would be to keep a population (ensemble) of policies, but only update using RL while sharing experience across all actors.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: This would isolate the ensemble effect from the evolutionary search.
label: none

sentence: Minor issues:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The ReLU non-linearity in DDPG and TD3 prior work is replaced with tanh.
label: none

sentence: This change is noted, but it would be useful to make a least a brief (i.e. one sentence) comment on the motivation for this change.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: - The paper is over the hard page limit for ICLR so needs to be edit to reduce the length.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Osband I, Blundell C, Pritzel A, Van Roy B. Deep exploration via bootstrapped DQN. InAdvances in neural information processing systems 2016 (pp. 4026-4034).
label: none

sentence: Summary:
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This paper looks at the MARL problem in high-dimensional continuous control settings.
label: none

sentence: To improve learning in this multi-agent setting, they propose to pre-train a lower-level policy that takes as input foot-step goals and is executed for a fixed number of timestep, thereby simplifying both the learning and exploration.
label: none

sentence: I'm a bit unsure of how to evaluate this paper.
label: none

sentence: On the one hand, I believe it has several contributions:
label: none

sentence: - Proposing a new MARL - continuous control environment
label: none

sentence: - Proposing a new lower-level policy for high-demensional continuous control environments, including how to learn it
label: none

sentence: - Using it to perform MARL in this environment
label: none

sentence: On the other hand, it is hard to say what the _main_ contribution is, which in turn makes it difficult to evaluate whether the experimental evaluation is sufficient:
label: none

sentence: Clearly, a main part of the paper is the work done to construct the hierarchical setup, including goal space, observation space and reward functions.
label: none

sentence: However, this work, as far as I can tell, is separate from the MARL problem.
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, there are several similar ideas already published, so comparison against those (for example by J. Peng, N. Heess or J. Mere) either as argument or even better as experiment, would be helpful to evaluate the quality of the proposed hierarchy.
label: none

sentence: On the other hand, there is the application of the hierarchical setup to the MARL problem.
label: none

sentence: However, as far as I can tell, there is no difference between applying such a hierarchy to the MARL case and to the single agent problem.
label: none

sentence: Especially if the lower-level component of the hierarchy is pre-trained in a non-MARL setup, it can just be seen as part of the environment from the point of view of the MARL training, offerring limited new insight into MARL.
label: none

sentence: I believe in the second paragraph of 4.1 the authors provide some insight into this matter, however, I have to admit I do not understand this paragraph:
label: none

sentence: - Why does temporal correlation reduce the non-stationarity of the MARL problem?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - Why does structured exploration reduce the number of network parameters that need to be learned?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - Why does partial parameter sharing make it easier for each agent to estimate other agents potential changes in behavior?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: In summary, I think this is interesting work, but a clearer explanation of the relationship between HRL and MARL, as well as a clearer main argument, supported by experimental evidence, would greatly improve this paper.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Edit:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Thank you for your response.
label: none

sentence: Unfortunately, I don't feel like it sufficiently addresses my questions and concerns.
label: none

sentence: I do apologize if my original comment wasn't clear regarding the contribution part of the paper. What I was trying to say is not that I didn't see the individual contributions of the paper, but instead that the paper does multiple things simultaneously, without comparing against the relevant baselines for any of the individual contributions.
label: none

sentence: Regarding my questions: I understand where the temporal correlation is coming from in an HRL setting.
label: none

sentence: However, what was not clear to me is how this reduces the non-stationarity of MARL.
label: none

sentence: I also understand that HRL can reduce the number of parameters, but I don't see how structured exploration reduces the number of parameters.
label: none

sentence: And lastly, I also can see how parameter sharing can simplify the learning, but I still don't see how it would allow agents to estimate the behaviour change of other agents easier.
label: none

sentence: I feel like in the paragraph in questions, a lot of causes and effects are mixed up and more careful descriptions of the benefits of the algorithm would help.
label: none

sentence: I want to re-iterate that I think that the submitted work by the authors is impressive and can provide valuable insights, but I believe it requires more work and more relevant baselines.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors extend an existing approach to adaptive softmax classifiers used for the output component of neural language models into the input component, once again allowing tying between the embedding and softmax.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This fills a significant gap in the language modeling architecture space, and the perplexity results bear out the advantages of combining adaptively-sized representations with weight tying.
label: none

sentence: While the advance is in some sense fairly incremental, the centrality of unsupervised language modeling to modern deep NLP (ELMo, BERT, etc.) implies that perplexity improvements as large as this one may have meaningful downstream effects on performance on other tasks.
label: none

sentence: Some things I noticed:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - One comparison that I believe is missing (I could be misreading the tables) is comparing directly to Merity et al.'s approach (adaptive softmax but fixed embedding/softmax dimension among the bands). Presumably you're faster, but is there a perplexity trade-off?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - The discussion/explanation of the differing performance of tying or not tying each part of the embedding weights for the different datasets is confusing; I think it could benefit from tightening up the wording but mostly I just had to read it a couple times. Perhaps all that's complicated is the distinction between embedding and projection weights; it would definitely be helpful to be as explicit about that as possible upfront.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: - The loss by frequency-bin plots are really fantastic.
label: none

sentence: You could also try a scatterplot of log freq vs. average loss by individual word/BPE token.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - Do you have thoughts as to why full-softmax BPE is worse than adaptive softmax word level?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: That goes against the current (industry) conventional wisdom in machine translation and large-scale language modeling that BPE is solidly better than word-level approaches because it tackles the softmax bottleneck while also sharing morphological information between words.
label: none

sentence: I vote to reject the paper at this stage, mainly because of the following three points:
label: none

sentence: 1) The motivation is unclear and overall structure of the paper is confusing.
label: none

sentence: It should be better motivated why one should use the duality gap as an upper bound for the "F-distance".
label: none

sentence: Minimizing the F-distance as is usually done seems like the more direct and simple approach.
label: none

sentence: Since the results are far from state of the art, a clean and neat presentation of the theoretical advantages and contributions is crucial.
label: none

sentence: 2) The presentation is not professional, hard to follow and the submission overall looks very rushed:
label: none

sentence: - In equations, please use \inf, \sup, and \text{...} for text such as distance, data, ...
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: - I have trouble understanding the overall idea behind Algorithm 1 and Eq. (22).
label: none

sentence: What is the definition of f^* and g^* in Eq. (22)? Some explanatory text would be valuable.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - The set F in Definition 3.5 looks odd, as it appears to be recursive and might not be unique.
label: none

sentence: - The writing looks very rushed, and should be improved.
label: none

sentence: For example, I have trouble understanding the sentence "So the existed algorithms should be heuristic or it can get a bad result even we train the neural networks with lots of datasets." in the introduction.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - The aspect ratio in Fig. 5 should be fixed.

sentence: 3) The experiments are completely preliminary and not reasonable:
label: none

sentence: - The WGAN-GP baseline is very weak, i.e. does not show any reasonable generated images (Fig. 9).
label: none

sentence: There are countless open pytorch implementations on GitHub which out-of-the-box produce much better results.
label: none

sentence: - The shown inception scores are far from state-of-the-art.
label: none

sentence: It is unclear, why one should use the proposed duality gap GAN.
label: none

sentence: The paper explores how the architecture, smoothness of the decision boundary and test accuracy of a model impacts the transferability of examples produced from it.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper provides a couple of novel insights, such as the asymmetry when transferring adversarial examples from one model to another.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: In addition, a novel method is proposed to enhance the transferability of adversarial examples from any model, through using smoothed gradients.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The experiments seem to show that the effect is rather large, and also makes the examples more robust to other transformations such as JPEG compression.
label: none

sentence: Overall, these are interesting insights that could lead to further developments in making models more robust to adversarial examples.
label: none

sentence: In particular, deriving adversarial examples that are both transferable and resilient to certain usual image transformations shows that the scope of the issue with adversarial examples may be even greater than what is understood today.
label: none

sentence: The paper is rather clear.
label: none

sentence: Unfortunately, it is riddled with grammatical errors and should be proof-read carefully. A lot of singular/plurals are off, and some formulations are odd or downright unclear.

sentence: Cons:

sentence: In 3/4 of the pairs the author tried, this phenomenon is not there. Whether the findings generalize to other situations where the phenomenon appears is uncertain.

sentence: - It is good that Section 5 has some theoretical analysis. But I personally find it very disturbing to base it on a 2nd order approximation of a probability density function of images when modeling something as intricate as models that generate images.

sentence: The paper presents a method of learning representations that is based on minimizing "deficiency" rather than optimizing for information sufficiency.

label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: better (more compressed representations), while performing equally on test accuracy.

sentence: The paper is well written and easy to read.

sentence: The idea behind the paper (optimizing for minimizing deficiency instead of sufficiency in IB) is interesting, especially because the variational formulation of DB is a generalization of VIB (in that VIB reduces to VDB for M=1).

sentence: 1) Summary
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This paper proposes a method for learning an agent by interacting and probing an expert agents behavior.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This method is composed of a policy that learns to imitate an expert’s action, and a policy that challenges the expert in order to get it to take multiple possible routes to solve a task.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The two policies share a “behavior tracker” that models the expert’s behavior, and communicates it to both policies being learned.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The probing policy is optimized using a curiosity-driven reward in order to get the expert take trajectories the probing policy has not seen before.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: In experiments, the authors perform experiments to show how the learned agent can generalize to unseen configurations in the corresponding environments in which the agents were trained, and also use the proposed technique in a sorting task in which the method generalizes to longer arrays to be sorted.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: 2) Pros:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: + Neat idea for exploring an experts behavior by changing the environment surrounding it (probing it).
label: none

sentence: + Cool experiments for applicability.
label: none

sentence: + Well written paper and easy to understand.
label: none

sentence: 3 Comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Equation 1 typo?:
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: To my understanding, in curiosity driven exploration, the exploration is driven based on how well the next state can be predicted by the agent.
label: none

sentence: In equation 1, different time steps are being compared, m^t and m^{t-1}, but the comparison should be between the predicted time step t and real time step t. Can the authors clarify why different time steps are compared in the equation?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: - Baseline missing: Random actions from expert
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: A simple baseline to compare against could be to simply force the expert to take a few random actions during its trajectory and let the imitator learn from these.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Comparing against this baseline could serve as evidence that we need to actually learn the probing agent to acquire a more optimal policy.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - Baseline missing: Simple RNN policies that communicate hidden states.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Another baseline could be to simply model the imitator and probing policies as RNNs and let them communicate with each other via the hidden states.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: While optimizing the curiosity reward the hidden states could be used as well.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: If successful, this baseline can show that we actually need to model the “behavior” with a separate network.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - Ablation study for the importance of fusion:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The authors have a “fusion” layer within the imitator and probing policies.
label: none

sentence: An ablation study showing that this layer is actually necessary is missing from the paper.
label: none

sentence: - Generalizability argument
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The authors claim that they show a single starting configuration for the agents during training, and different starting configurations during testing.
label: none

sentence: While I agree with this to some extent, I also think this argument may not be fully right. When the probing agent is testing the expert, it is essentially showing the imitator many different configurations of the environment.
label: none

sentence: It may not be that it changes in the first time step (for obvious reasons), but it is essentially showing it many configurations of the expert.
label: none

sentence: A more drastic change of the environment could make for a stronger argument.
label: none

sentence: 4) Conclusion:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Overall, I like the idea of having a policy that tries to figure out the general behavior of a demonstrator by probing it.
label: none

sentence: Having said that, I feel this paper needs to improve in the aspects mentioned above.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: If the authors present more convincing evidence that successfully address the comments above, I am willing to increase my score.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: The authors proposed a Modulated Variational auto-Encoders (MoVE) to perform musical timbre transfer.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors define timbre transfer as applying parts of the auditory properties of a musical instrument onto another.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: It replaces the usual adversarial translation criterion by a Maximum Mean Discrepancy (MMD) objective.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: By further conditioning our system on several different instruments, the proposed method can generalize to many-to-many transfer within a single variational architecture able to perform multi-domain transfers.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Some detailed comments are listed as follow,
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1 The implementation steps of the proposed method (MoVE) are not clear.

sentence: Some details are missing, which is hardly reproduced by the other researchers.
label: none

sentence: 2 The experimental settings are not reasonable.
label: none

sentence: The current experimental settings are not matched with the practice environment.
label: none

sentence: 3 The proposed method can transfer the positive knowledge.
label: none

sentence: However, some negative knowledge information can be also transferred.
label: none

sentence: So how to avoid the negative transferring?
label: none

sentence: 4 For the model, the optimization details or inferring details are missing, which are important for the proposed model.
label: none

sentence: I want thank the authors for solving this long-standing GAN challenge in raw waveform synthesis.
label: none

sentence: With all due respect, previous GAN trials for audio synthesis are inspiring, but their audio qualities are far away from the state-of-the-art results.

sentence: Although the speech fidelity of GAN-TTS is still worse than WaveNet and Parallel WaveNet from the posted sample, it has begun to close the significant performance gap that has existed between autoregressive models and GANs for raw audios.

sentence: Overall, this is a very good paper with significant contributions to the filed.

sentence: The authors study the generalization error of two-layer neural nets, where an asymptotic point of view is taken.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Their main results can be summarized as follows.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. If only the second layer is optimized, they observe the double-descent phenomenon.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: 2. However, if only the first layer is optimized, the double-descent is not observed.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This shows that recent results for certain linear models (e.g. Song, Montanari 2019) do not directly transfer to neural networks.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: As the authors point out, however, if a different scaling is used in the asymptotics, double descent might still be observed.

sentence: The authors suggest a method to create combined low-dimensional representations for combinations of pairs of words which have a specific syntactic relationship (e.g. adjective - noun).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Building on the generative word embedding model provided by Arora et al. (2015), their solution uses the core tensor from the Tucker decomposition of a 3-way PMI tensor to generate an additive term, used in the composition of two word embedding vectors.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Although the method the authors suggest is a plausible way to explicitly model the relationship between syntactic pairs and to create a combined embedding for them, their presentation does not make this obvious and it takes effort to reach the conclusion above.
label: none

sentence: Unlike Arora's original work, the assumptions they make on their subject material are not supported enough, as in their lack of explanation of why linear addition of two word embeddings should be a bad idea for composition of the embedding vectors of two syntactically related words, and why the corrective term produced by their method makes this a good idea.
label: none

sentence: Though the title promises a contribution to an understanding of word embedding compositions in general, they barely expound on the broader implications of their idea in representing elements of language through vectors.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Their lack of willingness to ground their claims or decisions is even more apparent in two other cases.
label: none

sentence: The authors claim that the Arora's RAND-WALK model does not capture any syntactic information.
label: none

sentence: This is not true.
label: none

sentence: The results presented by Arora et al. indeed show that RAND-WALK captures syntactic information, albeit to a lesser extent than other popular methods for word embedding (Table 1, Arora et al. 2015).
label: none

sentence: Another unjustified choice by the authors is their choice of weighing the Tensor term (when it is being added to two base embedding vectors) in the phrase similarity experiment.
label: none

sentence: The reason the authors provide for weighing the composition Tensor is the fact that in the unweighted version their model produced a worse performance than the additive composition.
label: none

sentence: One would at least expect an after-the-fact interpretation for the weighted tensor term and what this implies with regard to their method and syntactic embedding compositions in general.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Arora's generative model for word embeddings, on which the current paper is largely based upon, not only make the mathematical relationship among different popular word embedding methods explicit, but also by making and verifying explicit assumptions with regard to properties of the word embeddings created by their model, they are able to explain why low-dimensional embeddings provide superior performance in tasks that implicate semantic relationships as linear algebraic relations.
label: none

sentence: Present work, however interesting with regard to its potential implications, strays away from providing such theoretical insights and suffices with demonstrating limited improvements in empirical tasks.
label: none

sentence: The authors consider the scenario of two agents, a demonstrator acting in an environment to achieve a goal, and a learner, which can also interact with the environment, but whose goal is to learn the demonstrator’s policy by carrying out actions eliciting strong changes in the demonstrator’s trajectory.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The former is implemented as imitation learning, i.e. policy learning, the latter as curiosity driven RL.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors are encouraged to review some of the related literature on optimal teaching, which also has developed a rich set of approaches to agent modeling, e.g. the work by Patrick Shafto.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: It may also be relevant to think about the relationship to active learning in IRL.
label: none

sentence: I am not sure whether I would be able to implement and reproduce the presented work on the basis of the current manuscript including the appendix.
label: none

sentence: It would be very helpful for the community to be able to do so.
label: none

sentence: E.g., details on the the training of the demonstrators, their reward functions, and the behavior tracker.
label: none

sentence: Particularly the "fusion" module remains extremely unclear.
label: none

sentence: Overall, this is a nice paper, despite the fact that the example domains and problems considered are engineered strongly to allow for the proposed algorithm to be useful.
label: none

sentence: Particularly for the claim of generalization to different environments, the details are all in the engineering of the particular grid world tasks, how they relate to each other and the sate representation used for the demonstrator s_d.
label: none

sentence: I am not sure why it was submitted to ICLR and not the Annual Meeting of the Cognitive Science Society, though.
label: none

sentence: Minor points:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: “differs from this in two folds”
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: “by generate queries”
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: This paper presents a novel approach to bundle adjustment, where traditional geometric optimization is paired with deep learning.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Specifically, a CNN computes both a multi-scale feature pyramid and a depth prediction, expressed as a linear combination of "depth bases".
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: These values are used to define a dense re-projection error over the images, akin to that of dense or semi-dense methods.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Then, this error is optimized with respect to the camera parameters and depth linear combination coefficients using Levenberg-Marquardt (LM).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: By unrolling 5 iterations of LM and expressing the dampening parameter lambda as the output of a MLP, the optimization process is made differentiable, allowing back-propagation and thus learning of the networks' parameters.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper is clear, well organized, well written and easy to follow.
label: none

sentence: Even if the idea of joining BA / SfM and deep learning is not new, the authors propose an interesting novel formulation.
label: none

sentence: In particular, being able to train the CNN with a supervision signal coming directly from the same geometric optimization process that will be used at test time allows it to produce features that  will make the optimization smoother and the convergence easier.
label: none

sentence: The experiments are quite convincing and seem to clearly support the efficacy of the proposed method.
label: none

sentence: I don't really have any major criticism, but I would like to hear the authors' opinions on the following two points:
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: 1) In page 5, the authors write "learns to predict a better damping factor lambda, which gaurantees that the optimziation will converged to a better solution within limited iterations".
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: I don't really understand how learning lambda would _guarantee_ that the optimization will converge to a better solution.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: The word "guarantee" usually implies that the effect can be somehow mathematically proved, which is not done in the paper.
label: none

sentence: 2) As far as I can understand, once the networks are learned, possibly on pairs of images due to GPU memory limitations, the proposed approach can be easily applied to sets of images of any size, as the features and depth predictions can be pre-computed and stored in main system memory.
label: none

sentence: Given this, I wonder why all experiments are conducted on sets of two to five images, even for Kitti where standard evaluation protocols would demand predicting entire sequences.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: This paper tackles vulnerability to poisoning.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: An important subtopic of adversarial ML.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors propose using a GAN to generate poisoning data points, as an alternative to existing methods.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: While most (or all) of the paper is devoted to illustrate the effectiveness of the approach against *non-protected* ML. My only and biggest concern with this paper is that no defense mechanism has been tested against, and there are many in the literature. (see e.g. Diakonikolas et al ICML 2019).
label: none

sentence: Thus my question for the rebuttal period: How would pGAN perform when defense mechanisms are deployed during the learning phase? (ideally, a thorough experiment illustrating the strength of pGAN against a few defense mechanisms would help re-evaluating the score)
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: edit: the authors added several experiments (better evaluation of the predicted lambda, comparison with CodeSLAM), which address my concerns.
label: none

sentence: I think the paper is much more convincing now. I am happy to increase my rating to clear accept.
label: none

sentence: I also agree with the introduction of the Chi vector, and with the use of the term of "photometric BA", since it was used before, even if it is unfortunate in my opinion.
label: none

sentence: I thank the authors to replace reprojection by alignment, which is much clearer.
label: none

sentence: This paper presents a method for dense Structure-from-Motion using Deep Learning:
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The input is a set of images; the output is the camera poses and the depth maps for all the images.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The approach is inspired by Levenberg-Marquardt optimization (LM): A pipeline extracting image features computes the Jacobian of an error function.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This Jacobian is used to update an estimate of the camera poses.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: As in LM optimization, this update is done based on a factor lambda, weighting a gradient descent step and a Gauss-Newton step.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: In LM optimization, this lambda evolves with the improvement of the estimate.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Here lambda is also predicted using a network based on the feature difference.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: If I understand correctly, what is learned is how to compute image features that provide good updates, how to predict the depth maps from the features, and how to predict lambda.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The method is compared against DeMoN and other baselines with good results.
label: none

sentence: I like the fact that the method is based on LM optimization, which is the standard method in 'geometric bundle adjustment', while related works consider Gauss-Newton-like optimization steps.
label: none

sentence: The key was to include a network to predict lambda as well.
label: none

sentence: However, I have several concerns:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: * the ablation study designed to compare with a Gauss-Newton-like approach does not seem correct.
label: none

sentence: The image features learned with the proposed method are re-used in an approach using a fixed lambda.
label: arg-structuring_quote

sentence: If I understand correctly, there are 2 things wrong with that:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - for GN optimization, lambda should be set to 0 - not a constant value.
label: none

sentence: Several constant values should also have been tried.
label: none

sentence: - the image features should be re-trained for the GN framework:  Since the features are learned for the LM iteration, they are adapted to the use of the predicted lambda, but they are not necessarily suitable to GN optimization.
label: none

sentence: Thus, the advantage of using a LM optimization scheme is not very convincing.
label: none

sentence: Since the LM-like approach is the main contribution, and the reported experiments do not show an advantage over GN-like approaches (already taken by previous work), this is my main reason for proposing rejection.
label: none

sentence: * CodeSLAM (best paper at CVPR'18) is referenced but there is no comparison with it, while a comparison on the EuRoC dataset should be possible.
label: none

sentence: Less critical concerns that still should be taken into account if the paper is accepted:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - the state vector Chi is not defined for the proposed method, only for the standard bundle adjustment approach. If I understand correctly is made of the camera poses.
label: none

sentence: - the name 'Bundle Adjustment' is actually not adapted to the proposed method.
label: none

sentence: 'Bundle Adjustment' in 'geometric computer vision' comes from the optimization of several rays to intersect at the same 3D point, which is done by minimizing the reprojection errors.
label: none

sentence: Here the objective function is based on image feature differences.
label: none

sentence: I thus find the name misleading.
label: none

sentence: The end of Section 3 also encourages the reader to think that the proposed method is based on the reprojection error.
label: arg-structuring_quote

sentence: The proposed method is more about dense alignment for multiple images.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This paper introduced a proximal approach to optimize neural networks by linearizing the network output instead of the loss function.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: They demonstrate their algorithm on multi-class hinge loss, where they can show that optimal step size can be computed in close form without significant additional cost.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Their experimental results showed competitive performance to SGD/Adam on the same network architectures.
label: none

sentence: Figure 1 is crucial to the algorithm design as it aims to prove that Loss-Preserving Linearization (LPL) preserves information on loss function.
label: none

sentence: While the authors provided numerical plots to compare it with the SGD linearization, I personally prefer to see some analytically comparsion between SGD linearization and LPL even on the simplest case.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: An appendix with more numerical comparisons on other loss functions might also be insightful.
label: none

sentence: 2. It seems LPL is mainly compared to SGD for convergence (e.g. Fig 2).
label: none

sentence: In Table 2 I saw some optimizers end up with much lower test accuracy.
label: none

sentence: Can the authors show the convergence plots of these methods (similar to Figure 2)?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: This paper investigates an SGD variant (PowerSGD) where the stochastic gradient is raised to a power of $\gamma \in [0,1]$.  The authors introduce PowerSGD and PowerSGD with momentum (PowerSGDM).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The theoretical proof of  the convergence is given and experimental results show that the proposed algorithm converges faster than some of the existing popular adaptive SGD techniques.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Intuitively, the proposed PowerSGD can boost the gradient (since $\gamma \in [0,1]$) so it may be helpful for the gradient of the lower layers of a deep network which may be hit by the vanishing gradient issue.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This may give rise to a faster convergence.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: So overall the idea makes sense but I have the following concerns.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The major issue I have with this paper is Theorem 3.1 on the ergodic convergence rate of the proposed PowerSGD.
label: none

sentence: At the first glance, it is $O(\frac{1}{T})$ which is faster than the conventional SGD convergence rate $O(\frac{1}{\sqrt{T}})$.  But after a closer look, this rate is obtained by a very strong assumption on the batch size $B_{t}=T$.
label: none

sentence: In other words, when the number of iterations is large, the batch size will be large too.
label: none

sentence: I consider this assumption unrealistic.
label: none

sentence: Given that $T$ is typically very large (it is iterations, not epochs),  it will require a huge batch size, probably close to the whole training set.
label: none

sentence: In this case, it is basically a GD, not SGD any more.
label: none

sentence: That's why the rate is $O(\frac{1}{T})$, which is the convergence rate of GD.
label: none

sentence: I would like to see a convergence proof where the batch size $B_{t}$ is treated as a small constant like other SGD proofs assume.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Actually in the experiments the authors never use an increasing batch size.
label: none

sentence: Instead, a constant batch size 128 is used.
label: none

sentence: Therefore,  the faster convergence demonstrated in the experiments can not be explained by Theorem 3.1 or Theorem 3.2.
label: none

sentence: 2. There are numerous inaccuracies in the proof given the supplementary material.
label: none

sentence: For instance, in Eq.7,
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: $\nabla f(x) \sigma(\nabla f(x))$
label: arg-structuring_quote

sentence: should be $\nabla f(x)^{T} \sigma(\nabla f(x))$   The random variable $\xi_{t}$ should be a scalar on training samples, not a vector, etc..  The authors should clean it up.
label: none

sentence: 3. It would be helpful to show the $\gamma$ value on each experiment with different tasks.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: It would be good to know how $\gamma$ varies across tasks.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: 4. I think in the comparative experiments, the plain SGD should be added as another reference algorithm.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: 5. The term "PowerSGD" seems to have been used by other papers.
label: none

sentence: This paper presents a classification method when the data consists of few clean labels and many noisy labels.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors propose to construct a graph structure within each class and use graph convolutional network to determine the clean/noisy labels of samples in each class.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The model is based on a binary cross entropy loss function in each class, which learns the probability of labels to be clean. And such "clean" probability is used as the measure of relevance score between the sample different classes.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The idea of this paper is straightforward and the experimental results seem promising.
label: none

sentence: The authors compare with several related methods and show the proposed method has better performance in few shot learning experiments.
label: none

sentence: For the motivation of this methods, why would the graph be constructed within each class? If there is correlation between different classes, how could the model use such class-wise correlation to clean the label?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: Maybe I missed it, but how is the relevance score / predicted label determined for testing data given the graphs constructed in each class of training data?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: - In the empirical results, the performance of the proposed method and Reg-GAN (from the numerics of GAN paper) are quite similar. Are there instances that the proposed approach significantly improves the stability of practical GAN architectures?

sentence: This paper presents a set of statistical tools, that are applicable to quantitatively measuring the mode collapse of GANs.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors consistently observe strong mode collapse on several state-of-the-art GANs using the proposed toolset.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors analyze possible causes, and for the first time present two simple yet effective “black-box” methods to calibrate the GAN learned distribution, without accessing either model parameters or the original training data.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The writing and presentation are good.
label: none

sentence: My concerns regarding this paper are as below.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1) I wonder if the proposed method work for most GAN models, more experiments evaluated on more recent GAN-based  models should be added to verify the superiority claimed in this paper, e.g., TP-GAN [Huang et al., ICCV 2017], PIM [Zhao et al., CVPR 2018], DR-GAN [Tran et al., CVPR 2017], DA-GAN [Zhao et al., NIPS 2017], MH-Parser [Li et al., 2017], 3D-PIM [Zhao et al., IJCAI 2018], SimGAN [Shrivastava et al., CVPR 2016], AIM [Zhao et al., AAAI 2019].
label: none

sentence: 2) The main contributions of this paper are not quite clear to me.
label: none

sentence: 3) Typos need to be corrected in next version, e.g., all equations should have punctuation mark at the end, all e.g., i.e., et al., etc. should be italic, format of references should be consistent.
