sentence: This paper proposes a hybrid machine learning algorithm using Gradient Boosted Decision Trees (GBDT) and Deep Neural Networks (DNN).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The intended research direction on tabular data is essential and promising.
label: none

sentence: However, the proposed technique does not seem to be handling the problem foundationally well.
label: none

sentence: It seems heavily dependent on GBDT.
label: none

sentence: It also shows itself in the results that final algorithm is almost indistinguishable from GBDT regarding results.
label: none

sentence: Moreover, I  don't think that the data sets in experiments are good enough to cover the importance and the nature of the problem.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: -This is a crucial line of research direction that aims to make DNNs applicable to many real-world problems (beyond speech and vision) in which discrete data and heterogeneous features exist such as engagement prediction, recommendation, and search.
label: none

sentence: -The starting point of using GBDT seems like a good choice.
label: none

sentence: -The Paper is mostly well written except occasional repetitions and missing acronym definitions.
label: none

sentence: Cons:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: -The proposed technique does not seem to be original enough, and it does not handle the problem foundationally well.
label: none

sentence: I do not think that there is enough justification/demonstration for the fact that a general NN solution for Tabular Data invented.
label: none

sentence: The proposed technique is heavily dependent on GBDT (Indeed the algorithm and the learned trees are used at least three times).
label: none

sentence: This shows itself in the results; i.e., the proposed algorithm is either negligibly performing better than GBDT or when  GBDT dependence removed, it performs worse. It seems to me
label: none

sentence: that (except the minor small section of streaming data), the paper is more like a proper verification of how tree-based learning algorithms work very well in tabular data--which is far from the basis of the paper and does not make the paper novel enough for ICLR.
label: none

sentence: -The proposed technique seems to include very heavy feature engineering and several ad-hoc practical steps--that is far from the motivation of using NN in tabular data.
label: none

sentence: -In the provided benchmark data sets the depth of the analysis seems to be enough.
label: none

sentence: However, in the proposed domain of tabular data, often data sets are significantly more high dimensional in reality and include at least one set of sparse large dimensional features
label: none

sentence: (e.g., unstructured raw text for the search queries.) In such scenarios, it had been showed that wide-and-deep NNs perform decently.
label: none

sentence: However such problems are entirely missing in the results section.
label: none

sentence: I also think that this is a lost opportunity for the authors as they could be showing that it is the NN part contributing.
label: none

sentence: This paper studies the problem of generating contracts by a principal to incentive agents to optimally accomplish multiagent tasks.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The setup of the environment is that the agents have certain skills and preferences for activities, which the principal must learn to act optimally.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper takes a combined approach of agent modeling to infer agent skills and preferences, and a deep reinforcement learning approach to generate contracts.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The evaluation of the approach is fairly thorough.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The main novel contribution of the paper is to introduce the principal-agent problem to the deep multiagent reinforcement learning literature.
label: none

sentence: My concerns are:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The paper should perform a literature search on related work from operations research, including especially principal-agent problems, which are not currently surveyed, and perhaps also optimal scheduling problems.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - How do the problems introduced either map onto real applications or map onto environments studied in existing literature (such as in operations research)?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - More details should be given on the mind tracker module.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: - Is it necessary to use deep reinforcement learning for contract generation?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: If the agent modeling is good, the optimal contracts look like they are probably simple to compute directly in the environments studied.
label: none

sentence: Overall, the paper is somewhat interesting and relatively technically sound, but the contribution seems marginal. The problems studied seem pulled out a hat, when they could be situated in specific existing literature.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Dual Block-Coordinate Frank-Wolfe (Dual-BCFW) has been widely used in the literature of non-smooth and strongly-convex stochastic optimization problems, such as (structural) Support Vector Machine.
label: none

sentence: To my knowledge, the submission is the first sound attempt to adapt this type of Dual-based algorithm for optimization of Deep Neural Network, which employs a proximal-point method that linearizes not the whole loss function but only the DNN (up to the logits) to form a convex subproblem and then deal with the loss part in the dual.
label: none

sentence: The attempt is not perfect (actually with a couple of issues detailed below), but the proposed approach is inspiring and I personally would love it published to encourage more development along this thread.
label: none

sentence: The following points out a couple of items that could probably help further improve the paper.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: *FW vs BCFW*
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The algorithm employed in the paper is actually not Frank-Wolfe (FW) but Block-Coordinate Frank-Wolfe (BCFW), as it minimizes w.r.t. a block of dual variables belonging to the min-batch of samples.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: *Batch Size*
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Though the algorithm can be easily extended to the min-batch case, the author should discuss more how the batch size is interpreted in this case (i.e. minimizing w.r.t. a larger block of dual variables belonging to the batch of samples) and the algorithmic block (Algorithm 1) should be presented in a way reflecting the batch size since this is the way people use an algorithm in practice (to improve the utilization rate of a GPU).
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: *Convex-Conjugate Loss*
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The Dual FW algorithm does not need to be used along with the hinge loss (SVM loss).
label: none

sentence: All convex loss function can derive a dual formulation based on its convex-conjugate.
label: none

sentence: See [1,2] for examples.
label: arg-structuring_quote

sentence: It would be more insightful to compare SGD vs dual-BCFW when both of them are optimizing the same loss functions (either hinge loss or cross-entropy loss) in the experimental comparison.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: [1] Shalev-Shwartz, Shai, and Tong Zhang. "Stochastic dual coordinate ascent methods for regularized loss minimization." JMLR (2013)
label: none

sentence: [2] Tomioka, Ryota, Taiji Suzuki, and Masashi Sugiyama. "Super-linear convergence of dual augmented Lagrangian algorithm for sparsity regularized estimation." JMLR (2011).
label: none

sentence: *BCFW vs BCD*
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Actually, (Lacoste-Julien, S. et al., 2013) proposes Dual-BCFW to optimize structural SVM because the problem contains exponentially many number of dual variables.
label: none

sentence: For typical multiclass hinge loss problem the Dual Block-Coordinate Descent that minimizes w.r.t. all dual variables of a sample in a closed-form update converges faster without extra computational cost.
label: none

sentence: See the details in, for example, [3, appendix for the multiclass hinge loss case].
label: arg-structuring_quote

sentence: [3] Fan, Rong-En, et al. "LIBLINEAR: A library for large linear classification." JMLR (2008).
label: none

sentence: *Hyper-Parameter*
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The proposed dual-BCFW still contains a hyperparameter (eta) due to the need to introduce a convex subproblem, which makes its number of hyperparameters still the same to SGD.
label: none

sentence: In this paper the authors proposed a new policy gradient method, which is known as the angular policy gradient (APG), that aims to provide provably lower variance in the gradient estimate.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Here they presented a stochastic policy gradient method for directional control.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Under the set of parameterized Gaussian policies, they presented a unified analysis of the variance of APG and showed how it theoretically outperform (in terms of having lower variance) than other state-of-the art methods.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: They further evaluated the APG algorithms on a grid-world navigation domain as well as the King of Glory task, and showed that the APG estimator significantly out-performs the standard policy gradient.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: In general I think this paper addressed an important issue in policy gradient in terms of deriving a lower variance gradient estimate.
label: none

sentence: In particular the authors showed that under the parameterized marginal distribution, such as the angular Gaussian distribution, the corresponding APG estimate has a lower variance estimate than that of CAPG.
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, I also appreciate that they evaluated these results in realistic experiments such as the RTS game domains.
label: none

sentence: My only question is on the possibility of deriving realistic APG algorithms beyond the class of angular Gaussian policy.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: In terms of the layout of the paper, I would also recommend including the exact algorithm pseudo-code used in the main paper.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Summary
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This paper proposes to learn disentangled latent states under the GAN framework.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The core idea is to partition the latent states into N partitions, and correspondly have N Siamese networks that pull the generated images with the same latent partition towards each other, along with a contrastive loss which ensures generated images with different latent partitions to be different.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors experiment with two setups: in the "unguided setup" training is completely unsupervised, while in the "guided" setup, there is some weak supervision to encourage different partitions to learn different factors.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Evaluation
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: While the motivation is nice, I find the results (especially in the unguided setup) underwhelming.
label: none

sentence: This does not seem surprising to me, as in the unguided case, the constrative loss seems not strong enough to encourage the latent partitions to be different.
label: none

sentence: Results with weak supervision (their method for injecting weak supervision was very nice)
label: none

sentence: are more impressive.
label: none

sentence: However, there is no comparison against existing work.
label: none

sentence: Learning disentangled representations with deep generative models is very much an active area.
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes two modifications for the MixMatch method [1] and achieves improved accuracy on a range of semi-supervised benchmarks.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The first modification enforces the distribution of predicted labels to match the distribution of labeled data.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The second modification is adding a learned data augmentation strategy, and adapting the method to work with strong data augmentation.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The final method is titled ReMixMatch, and improves significantly over MixMatch, especially in low-data regime.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The main contribution of the paper is really strong empirical results.
label: none

sentence: The method achieves state of the art results or close to that on multiple benchmarks, with especially large gains in settings with very scarce labeled data, like 40 labels on CIFAR-10.
label: none

sentence: Another important contribution is the learned data augmentation strategy, which as far as I understand is novel and overcomes some of the limitations of  existing learned data augmentation techniques.
label: none

sentence: However, the explanation of the strategy wasn’t very clear for me, and the authors didn’t frame it as a major contribution.
label: none

sentence: The main drawback of the paper is that it seems to be more engineering-focused, and doesn’t provide much insight into semi-supervised learning.
label: none

sentence: The paper can be summarized as adding two modifications to mix-match, and getting better results.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The final method becomes fairly involved.
label: none

sentence: Mix-Match is already an elaborate method, and ReMixMatch additionally introduces learned data augmentation, an additional loss term for matching label distributions between labeled and unlabeled data, consistency-loss, and a self-supervised loss (section 3.3).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: For the reasons above, I think the paper is borderline, but I am currently voting for acceptance based on the strong empirical performance.
label: none

sentence: At the same time, I think the paper can be made stronger and more interesting to read, if the authors added some experiments aimed at understanding the proposed modifications.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: One set of experiments that I think would be interesting is aimed at understanding the distribution-matching part.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: For example, it would be great if the author could demonstrate that without this loss term the distribution of the predicted classes is wrong in the experiments from Section 4.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: It would also be interesting to see an experiment where the labeled data has a skewed distribution of classes, but we provide the method with information about the true class distribution, and demonstrating that this information helps predictive performance.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: For the learnable data augmentation it would be great if the authors could provide more insight into the method, how it works, and why is it better than the alternatives.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Just analyzing the learned data augmentation in different settings and adding more intuition for what happens would make the paper more insightful and interesting to read.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: On a more minor note, the paper [1] seems to report 4.95 accuracy for MixMatch on CIFAR-10 with 4k labels, while in this paper it’s being reported as 6.24.
label: none

sentence: What is the reason for the difference?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Another paper, [2], reports very competitive results on CIFAR-10 for 4k labels.
label: none

sentence: I would recommend discussing these results briefly in the paper.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: At the same time the empirical performance of ReMixMatch is really impressive, and I don’t think the results in [1] and [2] affect their significance.
label: none

sentence: This paper presents some experiments using random projections instead of embeddings from a 1-of-V encoding.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Experiments on the Penn TreeBank benchmark data set show that in a feed-forward language modeling architecture similar to that of (Bengio, 2003), the random projections substantially reduce the number of parameters of the model while not harming perplexity too much.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper would need to be improved substantially in order to appear at a conference like ICLR.
label: none

sentence: First, the novelty of the approach is limited -- the approach amounts to using a sparse integer layer instead of a floating-point layer within a feed-forward architecture.
label: none

sentence: Second, and more importantly, the experiments need to be re-done to better measure the practical impact of the techniques.
label: none

sentence: First, larger data sets such as Wikitext-2 and Wikitext-103, and/or the billion-word benchmark, are needed to understand how well the approach works in practical LM settings.
label: none

sentence: Second, the paper needs to use more state-of-the-art architectures.
label: none

sentence: Language modeling is a fast-moving field, so the very latest and greatest techniques are not strictly necessary for this paper, but at least midsize LSTM models that get scores in the ~80 ppl range for Penn Treebank are important, otherwise it becomes very questionable whether the results will provide any practical impact in today's best models.
label: none

sentence: Finally, the paper needs to compare its parameter-reduction approaches against other compression and hyperparameter optimization techniques.

sentence: Changing the number/sizes of the network layers or using sparse weight matrices (perhaps with sparsity-inducing regularization) would be natural ways to reduce the parameter space.

sentence: This paper addresses to compress the network weights by quantizing their values to some fixed codeword vectors.

sentence: The authors verify the proposed algorithm by comparing it with existing algorithms for ResNet-18 and ResNet-50.

sentence: Overall, I think that the proposed algorithm is easy to apply and the draft is relatively well written.

sentence: The paper presents a combination of evolutionary search methods (CEM) and deep reinforcement learning methods (TD3).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The CEM algorithm is used to learn a Diagional Gaussian distribution over the parametes of the policy.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The population is sampled from the distribution.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Half of the population is updated by the TD3 gradient before evaluating the samples.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: For filling the replay buffer of TD3, all state action samples from all members of the population are used.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The algorithm is compared against the plane variants of CEM and TD3 as well as against the evoluationary RL (ERL) algorithm.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Results are promising with a negative result on the swimmer_v2 task.
label: none

sentence: The paper is well written and easy to understand.

sentence: While the presented ideas are well motivated and it is certainly a good idea to combine deep RL and evoluationary search, novelty of the approach is limited as the setup is quite similar to the ERL algorithm (which is still on archive and not published, but still...).

sentence: - The importance mixing does not seem to provide a better performance and could therefore be shortened in the paper

sentence: The paper studies several different techniques for training GANs: the architecture chosen, the loss function of the discriminator and generator,
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: and training techniques: normalization methods, ratio between updates of discriminator and generator, and regularization.
label: none

sentence: The method is performing an empirical training study on three image datasets, modifying the training procedure (e.g. changing one of the parameters) and using different metrics to evaluate the performance of the trained network.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Since the space of possible hyper-parameters , training algorithms, loss functions and network architecture is huge , the authors set a default training procedure, and in each numerical experiment freeze all techniques and parameters
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: except for one or two which they modify and evaluate.
label: none

sentence: The results of the paper do not give major insights into what are the preferred techniques for training GANs, and certainly not why and under what circumstances they'll work.
label: none

sentence: The authors recommend using non-saturated GANs loss and spectral normalization when training on new datasets, because these techniques achieved good performance metrics in most experiments.
label: none

sentence: But there is no attempt to generalize the findings (e.g. new datasets not from original study, changing other parameters and then evaluating again if these techniques help etc.), not clear
label: none

sentence: if the
label: none

sentence: improvement in performance is statistically significant, how robust it is to changes in other parameters etc.
label: none

sentence: The authors also rely mostly on the FID metric, but do not show if and how there is improvement upon visual inspection of the generated images (i.e. is resolution improved, is fraction of images that look clearly 'unnatural' reduced etc.)
label: none

sentence: The writing is understandable for the most part, but the paper seems to lack focus - there is no clear take home message.
label: none

sentence: The authors use numerous jargon words to describe the techniques studied (e.g. dragon penalty, gradient penalty, spectral normalization, Gaussian process regression in the bandit setting) but they do not explain them,
label: none

sentence: give mathematical formulations, or insights into their advantages/disadvantages, making it hard to the non-expert reader to understand what are these techniques and why are they introduced.
label: none

sentence: With lack of clear novel insights, or at least more systematic study on additional datasets of the 'winning' techniques and a sensitivity analysis, the paper does not give a valuable enough contribution to the field to merit publication.
label: none

sentence: I really enjoyed reading the paper! The exposition is clear with interesting observations, and most importantly, the authors walk the extra mile in doing a theoretical analysis of the observed phenomena.
label: none

sentence: Questions for the authors:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. (Also AREA CHAIR NOTE): Another parallel submission to ICLR titled “Generative Ensembles for Robust Anomaly Detection” makes similar observations and seemed to suggest that ensembling can help counter the observed CIFAR/SVHN phenomena unlike what we see in Figure 10.
label: none

sentence: Their criteria also accounts for the variance in model log-likelihoods and is hence slightly different.
label: none

sentence: 2. Even though Figure 2b shows that SVHN test likelihoods are higher than CIFAR test likelihoods, the overlap in the histograms of CIFAR-train and CIFAR-test is much higher than the overlap in CIFAR-train and SVHN-test.
label: none

sentence: If we define both maximum and minimum thresholds based on the CIFAR-train histogram, it seems like one could detect most SVHN samples just by the virtue that there likelihoods are much higher than even the max threshold determined by the CIFAR-train histogram?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 3. Why does the constant image (all zeros) in Figure 9 (appendix) have such a high likelihood? It’s mean (=0 trivially) is clearly different from the means of the CIFAR-10 images (Figure 6a) so the second order analysis of Section 5 doesn’t seem applicable.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 4. How much of this phenomena do you think is characteristic for images specifically? Would be interesting to test anomaly detection using deep generative models trained on modalities other than images.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: 5. One of the anonymous comments on OpenReview is very interesting: samples from a CIFAR model look nothing like SVHN.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: This seems to call the validity of the anomalous into question. Curious what the authors have to say about this.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Minor nitpick: There seems to be some space crunching going on via Latex margin and spacing hacks that the authors should ideally avoid :)
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: This paper introduces a structured drop-in replacement for linear layers in a neural network, referred to as Kaleidoscope matrices.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The class of such matrices are proven to be highly expressive and includes a very general class of sparse matrices, including convolution, Fastfood, and permutation matrices.
label: none

sentence: Experiments are carried in a variety of settings: (i) can nearly replace a series of hand-designed feature extractor, (ii) can perform better than fixed permutation matrices (though parameter count also increased by 10%), (iii) can learn permutations, and (iv) can help reduce parameter count and increase inference speed with a small performance degradation of 1.0 BLEU on machine translation.
label: none

sentence: This appears to be a solid contribution in terms of both theory and practical use.
label: none

sentence: As I have not thought much about expressiveness in terms of arithmetic circuits (though I was unable to fully follow or appreciate the derivations, the explanations all seem reasonable)
label: none

sentence: , my main comments are regarding experiments.
label: none

sentence: Though there are experiments in different domains, each could benefit from some additional ablations, especially to existing parameterizations of structured matrices such as Fastfood, ACDC, and any of the multiple works on permutation matrices and/or orthogonal matrices.
label: none

sentence: Though Kaleidoscope include these as special cases, it is not clear whether when given the same resources (either memory or computational cost), Kaleidoscope would outperform them.
label: none

sentence: There is also a matter of ease of training compared to existing approximations or relaxations, e.g. Gumbel-Sinkhorn.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The writing is easy to follow and concise, with contributions and place in the literature clearly stated.
label: none

sentence: - The Kaleidoscope matrix seem generally applicable, both proven theoretically and shown empirically (experiments are spread across a wide range of domains).
label: none

sentence: - The code includes specific C++ and CUDA kernels for computing K matrices, which will be very useful for adaptation.
label: none

sentence: - The reasoning using arithmetic circuits seems interesting, and the Appendix includes a primer.
label: none

sentence: Cons:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - For the squeezenet and latent permutation experiments, would be nice if there is a comparison to other parameterizations of permutation matrices, e.g. gumbel-sinkhorn.
label: none

sentence: - For the speed processing experiment, did you test what the performance would be if K matrix is replaced by a fully connected layer?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: This comparison appears in other experiments, but seems to be missing here for some reason.
label: none

sentence: It would lead to better understanding than only comparing to SincNet.
label: none

sentence: - The setup for the learning to permute experiment is not as general as it would imply in the main text.
label: none

sentence: The matrices are constrained so that an actual permutation matrix is always sampled, and the permutation is (had to be?) pretrained to reduce total variation for 100 epochs before jointly trained with the classifier.
label: none

sentence: Though this is stated very clearly in the Appendix, I hope the authors can also communicate this clearly in the main text as it appears to be a crucial component of the experimental setup.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: Comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - How easy is it to train with K matrices? Did you have to change optimizer hyperparameter compared to existing baselines?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - There seems to be some blurring between the meaning of structure (used to motivate K matrices in the introduction) and sparsity (used to analyze K matrices).
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Structure might also include parameter sharing, orthogonality, and maybe other concepts.
label: none

sentence: For instance, while Kaleidoscope matrices might include the subclass of circulant matrices, can they also capture the same properties or "inductive bias" (for lack of better word) as convolutional layers when trained?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: Given a network and input model for generating adversarial examples, this paper presents an idea to quantitatively evaluate the robustness of the network to these adversarial perturbations.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Although the idea is interesting, I would like to see more experimental results showing the scalability of the proposed method and for evaluating defense strategies against different types of adversarial attacks.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Detailed review below:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - How does the performance of the proposed method scale wrt scalability? It will be useful to do an ablation study, i.e. keep the input model fixed and slowly increase the dimension.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - Did you experiment with other MH proposal beyond a random walk proposal? Is it possible to measure the diversity of the samples using techniques such as the effective sample size (ESS) from the SMC literature?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - What is the performance of the proposed method against "universal adversarial examples"?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - The most interesting question is whether this method gives reasonable robustness estimates even for large networks such as AlexNet?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - Please provide some intuition for this line in Figure 3: "while the robustness to perturbations of size  = 0:3 actually starts to decrease after around 20 epochs."
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - A number of attack and defense strategies have been proposed in the literature.
label: none

sentence: Isn't it possible to use the proposed method to quantify the increase in the robustness towards an attack model using a particular defense strategy? If it is possible to show that the results of the proposed method match the conclusions from these papers, then this will be an important contribution.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Summary:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This paper uses siamese networks to define a discriminative function for predicting protein-protein interaction interfaces.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: They show improvements in predictive performance over some other recent deep learning methods.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The work is more suitable for a bioinformatics audience though, as the bigger contribution is on the particular application, rather than the model / method itself.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Novelty:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The main contribution of this paper is the representation of the protein interaction data in the input layer of the CNN
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Clarity:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The paper is well written, with ample background into the problem.
label: none

sentence: Significance:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Their method improves over prior deep learning approaches to this problem.
label: none

sentence: However, the results are a bit misleading in their reporting of the std error.
label: none

sentence: They should try different train/test splits and report the performance.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - This is an interesting application paper and would be of interest to computational biologists and potentially some other members of the ICLR community

sentence: - Protein conformation information is not required by their method
label: none

sentence: Comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The authors should include citations and motivation for some of their choices (what sequence identity is used, what cut-offs are used etc)

sentence: -  The authors should compare to at least some popular previous approaches that use a feature engineering based methodology such as - IntPred

sentence: - The authors use a balanced ratio of positive and negative examples.
label: none

sentence: The true distribution of interacting residues is not balanced -- there are several orders of magnitude more non-interacting residues than interacting ones.

sentence: Can they show performance at various ratios of positive:negative examples?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: In case there is a consistent improvement over prior methods, then this would be a clear winner

sentence: This paper studies how the FiLM visual question answering (VQA) model answer questions involving the quantifier ‘most’.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This quantifier is chosen for study because it cannot be expressed in first order logic (i.e., high-order logic is required), and secondly because there are two different algorithmic approaches to answering questions involving ‘most’ (cardinality-based strategy and pairing-based strategy).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Experiments are performed by designing abstract visual scenes with controlled numerosity and spatial layouts, and applying methodologies from pyscholinguistics.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper concludes that the model learns an approximate number system (ANS), consistent with the cardinality-based strategy, with implications for understanding the conditions under which existing VQA models should perform well or badly (and possibly for improving VQA models).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Strengths:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The research question is clear and well-conceived. In general, it seems there are significant opportunities for better collaboration between the experimental psychology and machine learning communities, and this is a good example of the benefits.
label: none

sentence: - The paper is clear, highly-focused, and well-written.
label: none

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The arguments for why the experimental evidence actually supports the existance of an approximate number system (ANS) could be made more clear.
label: none

sentence: For example, the section on “Ratios andWeber fraction” argues that “these curves align well with the trend predicted by Weber’s law”, but does not explain how the experimental data would present if the alternative hypothesis (pairing-based strategy) was being used.
label: none

sentence: What would the pairing-based strategy look like in Figure 6 right? Are there not significance tests that could be used to more carefully quantify the level of support for the two alternative strategies?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - The experiments seem very similar to Wu et al. 2018, which is considered to be prior work under the ICLR guidelines.
label: none

sentence: While this paper is acknowledged in the related work, it would be helpful to expand further on the relationship between these works, so the originality and contribution of this paper can be better evaluated.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - In some ways it is not that surprising that the CNN more easily learns an approximate number system rather than a pairing-based algorithm, as the later would presumably need to learn a different convolutional filter for every possible spatial arrangement of the pairs (which would be very sample inefficient).
label: none

sentence: Therefore, it might be interesting to consider, are there any circumstances under which the CNN would learn a pairing based algorithm?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: For example, what if the spatial configuration of the pairs was simplified, so they were always side-by-side at a fixed distance? If pairing-based algorithms emerged under simplified scenarios, this might have implications for the design of CNN filters (if we want models that are capable of learning these types of functions).
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Summary:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: I regard this as a good paper, with a couple of weakness that could be addressed as indicated.
label: none

sentence: This paper studies the problem of coordinating many strategic agents with private valuation to perform a series of common goals.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The algorithm designer is a manager who can assign goals to various agents but cannot see their valuation or control them explicitly.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The manager has a utility function for various goals and wants to maximize the total revenue.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The abstract problem is well-motivated and significant and is an entire branch of study called algorithmic mechanism design.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: However often many assumptions have to be made to make the problem mathematically tractable.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: In this paper, the authors take an empirical approach by designing an RL framework that efficiently maximizes rewards across many episodes.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Overall I find the problem interesting, well-motivated.
label: none

sentence: The paper is well-written and contains significant experiments to support its point.
label: none

sentence: However, I do not have the necessary background in the related literature to assess the significance of the methods proposed compared to prior work and thus would refrain from making a judgment on the novelty of this paper in terms of methodology.
label: none

sentence: Here are some of my comments/questions to the author on this paper.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: (1) I want to clarify how the skills of the agents play a role in the problem setup. Does it show up in the expression for the manager's reward?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: In particular, does it affect the Indicator for whether a goal is completed Eq. (2) via a process that need not be explicitly modeled but can be observed via a feedback of whether or not the goal is completed?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: So in the case of resource collection example, the skill set is a binary value for each resource, whether it can be collected or not?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: (2) Related to the first point, the motivation for modeling the agents as maximizing their utility is the assumption that agents do not know their skills. I am wondering, is this really justified? Over the course of episodes, can the agents learn their skills based on the relationship between their intention and the goals they achieve? In the resource collection example, when they reach a resource and are not able to collect it, they understand that they do not have the corresponding skill.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Is there a way to extrapolate the results from this paper to such a setting?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: (3) I am slightly concerned about the sample complexity of keeping track of the probability of worker i finishing goal g within t steps with a bonus b. This scales linearly in parameters which usually would be large (such as the number of time-steps).
label: none

sentence: Are there alternate ways to overcome maintaining the UCB explicitly, especially for the number of time-steps?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: Some minor comments on the presentation.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: (1) What are the units for rewards in the plots? Is it the average per episode reward? It would be good to mention this in the caption.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: (2) There are a few typos in the paper.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Some I could catch was,
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Last line in Page 5: "quantitative" -> "quantity"
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: - Page 8: skills nad preferences -> skills and preferences
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: - Page 8: For which we combining -> for which we combine
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: Summary
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The authors make three major contributions that improve MixMatch and achieve state-of-the-art in a semi-supervised image classification task.
label: none

sentence: The major contributions include: (1) distribution alignment to calibrate the predicted distribution of unlabeled data; (2) augmentation anchoring to allow more aggressive data augmentation; and (3) CTAugment to train the augmentation policy alongside the semi-supervised model.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors conduct experiments on SVHN, CIFAR-10 and STL, and show significant improvements over the MixMatch baseline.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: They also show good results (15.08% error rate) of training with 40 labeled data, in spite of very high variation.
label: none

sentence: In the ablation study, they show the error rate drops as K (number of augmentation) increases.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: They also conduct ablation studies on the design choices of their method.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Decision
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: The decision for this paper is borderline, tending towards a weak accept.
label: none

sentence: Overall, the paper proposes some simple but interesting ideas, e.g. distribution environments.
label: none

sentence: However, although the proposed method achieves good performance over various (smaller) benchmarks, the method seems ad-hoc and complicated.
label: none

sentence: As pointed out in the weakness section, many design choices are not well motivated, and the effects of those designs are not well studied.
label: none

sentence: The tendency to accept is due to the overall strong results.
label: none

sentence: Strength
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. Significant improvement over MixMatch baseline.
label: none

sentence: 2. The proposed augmentation anchoring and distribution alignment can be easily integrated into existing work.
label: none

sentence: 3. The proposed CTAugment method lifts the burden of training an RL data augmentation policy.
label: none

sentence: Weakness
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. The objective of the update equation of CTAugment’s learned weights seems contradicted with the purpose of how data augmentation is used in the consistency-based SSL method.
label: none

sentence: In other words, the objective of the update equation encourages higher weights for the distortion parameter that leads to lower variation in the predicted distribution.
label: none

sentence: However, the idea of aggressive data augmentation is to generate data that has high variation in the model prediction, and then penalize the variation in the form of consistency loss.
label: none

sentence: The variation induced by aggressive augmentation is the root of the consistency loss that helps regularize the model.
label: none

sentence: 2. The authors should provide ablation study and analysis of their CTAugment.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: For example, they should compare with simple random augmentation policy.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: It is also recommended to show the learned weights of the distortion parameter.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Also does larger K value when applied for vanilla MixMatch approach the results in ReMixMatch?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: 3. The authors should provide more detail of the setting in the ablation study.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: For example, the setting of “No strong aug.” and “No weak aug.” are not clear.
label: none

sentence: 4. The authors hypothesize that “stronger augmentation can result in disparate predictions, so their average may not be a meaningful target.” However, they do not show any analysis to support this hypothesis.
label: none

sentence: 5. It is recommended to evaluate the method on larger datasets such as CIFAR-100.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: It is not clear how well these methods scale, and for example using k=8 adds computation which may hinder training scalability.
label: none

sentence: Minor Comments
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. For Table 2 and Table 3, it should be “error rate” rather than “accuracy”.
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: 2. How is the loss weight λr tuned in the 40 labeled setting? How are the hyper-parameters tuned in general?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: This paper provides some insights on influence of data distribution on robustness of adversarial training.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper demonstrates through a number of analysis that the distance between the training an test data sets plays an important role on the effectiveness of adversarial training.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: To show the latter, the paper proposes an approach to measure the distance between the two data sets using combination of nonlinear projection (e.g. t-SNE), KDE, and K-L divergence.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper also shows that under simple transformation to the test dataset (e.g. scaling), performance of adversarial training reduces significantly due to the large gap between training and test data set.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This tends to impact high dimensional data sets more than low dimensional data sets since it is much harder to cover the whole ground truth data distribution in the training dataset.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Pros:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Provides insights on why adversarial training is less effective on some datasets.
label: none

sentence: - Proposes a metric that seems to strongly correlate with the effectiveness of adversarial training.
label: none

sentence: Cons:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - Lack of theoretical analysis. It could have been nice if the authors could show the observed phenomenon analytically on some simple distribution.
label: none

sentence: - The marketing phrase "the blind-spot attach" falls short in delivering what one may expect from the paper after reading it.
label: none

sentence: The paper would read much better if the authors better describe the phenomena based on the gap between the two distribution than using bling-spot.
label: none

sentence: For some dataset, this is beyond a spot, it could actually be huge portion of the input space!
label: none

sentence: Minor comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - I believe one should not compare the distance shown between the left and right columns of Figure 3 as they are obtained from two different models.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Though the paper is not suggesting that, it would help to clarify it in the paper.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Furthermore, it would help if the paper elaborates why the distance between the test and training dataset is smaller in an adversarially trained network compared to a naturally trained network.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: - Are the results in Table 1 for an adversarially trained network or a naturally trained network?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: Either way, it could be also interesting to see the average K-L divergence between an adversarially and a naturally trained network on the same dataset.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - Please provide more visualization similarly to those shown in Fig 4.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: This paper used the concept based on channel deficiency to derive a variational bound similar to variational information bottleneck.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Theoretical analysis shows that this bound is an lower bound on the VIB objective.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The empirical analysis shows it outperforms VIB in some sense.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: I think this paper's contribution is rather theoretical than practical.
label: none

sentence: The experiments section can be improved in the following aspect:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: -  Figure 2 are hard to read for different M's. It would be better if the authors can show the exact accuracy numbers rather than the overlapped lines
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: - I(Z;Y) vs I(Z;X) graph is typically used in a VIB setting.
label: none

sentence: In the paper's variational deficiency setting, although plotting I(Z;Y) vs I(Z;X) is necessary, it would be also helpful for the authors' to plot Deficiency vs I(Z;X), because this is what new objective is trading-off.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: - Again, Figure 3, it is hard to see the benefits for increasing M from the visualizations for different clusterings.
label: none

sentence: - How do the paper estimate I(Z;Y) and I(Z;X) for plotting these figures? Does the paper use lower bound or some estimators? It should be made clear in the paper since these are non-trivial estimations.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: Last comment is that, although the concept of `deficiency` in a bottleneck setting is novel, the similar idea for tighter bound of log likelihood has already been pursed in the following paper:
label: none

sentence: - Yuri Burda, Roger Grosse, Ruslan Salakhutdinov. Importance Weighted Autoencoders. ICLR 2016
label: none

sentence: It was kind of surprising that the authors did not cite this paper given the results are pretty much the same.
label: none

sentence: It would also be helpful for the authors to do a comparison or connection section with this paper.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: I like the paper in general, but given it still has some space for improvement, I would keep my decision as boarder line for now.
label: none

sentence: This paper addresses the problem of adversarial transferability, i.e. the ability that an adversarial example generated by one model can successfully fool another model.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: There are numerous papers on this topic recently, such as Fawzi'15, Liu'17, Dong'18, Athalye'18...
label: none

sentence: The authors propose tot study two types of factors that might influence transferability: model-specific parameters and smoothness of loss surface for constructing adversarial examples.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Two experimental studies are made for each influence factor from existing architectures.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Another attack strategy aiming at smoothing the loss surface is proposed, an experimental evaluation shows the effectiveness of the proposed method.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Pros
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: -the proposed experimental studies can be interesting to the community
label: none

sentence: -many interesting illustrations are provided.
label: none

sentence: Cons
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: -The conclusions of the study were suggested by previous papers or are rather expected: adversarial transfer is not symmetric: Deep models less transferable than shallow ones, averaging gradient is better
label: none

sentence: -I find the experimental studies a bit limited and I would expect larger studies which would have improve the interest of the paper.
label: none

sentence: -Only two influence factors are studied, again the paper would be more interesting with a more general study
label: none

sentence: The paper has an interesting potential but seems a bit limited in its present form.
label: none

sentence: This paper displays an occurrence of density models assigning higher likelihood to out-of-distribution inputs compared to the training distribution.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Specifically, density models trained on CIFAR10 have higher likelihood on SVHN than CIFAR10.
label: none

sentence: This is an interesting observation because the prevailing assumption is that density models can distinguish inliers from outliers.
label: none

sentence: However, this phenomenon is not encountered when comparing MNIST and NotMNIST.
label: none

sentence: The SVHN/CIFAR10 phenomenon has also been shown in concurrent work [1].
label: none

sentence: Given that you observed that SVHN has higher likelihood on all three model types (PixelCNN, VAE, Glow), why investigate a component specific to just flow-based models (the volume term)?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: It seems reasonable to suspect that the phenomenon may be due to a common cause in all three model types.
label: none

sentence: For instance, the experiments seem to indicate that generalizing density estimation from CIFAR training set to CIFAR test set is likely challenging and thus the models underfit the true data distribution, resulting in the simpler dataset (SVHN) having higher likelihood.
label: none

sentence: Given the title of the paper, it would have been nice if this paper explored more than just MNIST vs NotMNIST and SVHN vs CIFAR10, so that the readers can gain a better feel for when generative models will be able to detect outliers.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: For instance, a scenario where the data statistics (pixel means and variances) are nearly equivalent for both datasets would be interesting.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: The second order analysis is good but it seems to come down to just a measure of the empirical variances of the datasets.
label: none

sentence: This paper is well written.
label: none

sentence: I think the presentation of this density modelling shortcoming is a good contribution but leaves a bit to be desired.

sentence: The paper analyzes the strategy that a visual question answering model (FiLM) uses to verify statements containing the quantifier "most" ("most of the dots are red").
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: It finds that the model is sensitive to the ratio of objects that satisfy the predicate (that are red) to objects that do not; as the ratio decreases (e.g. 10 red dots compared to 9 blue dots), the model's performance decreases too.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This is consistent with human behavior.
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: * The introduction lays out an ambitious program of comparing humans to deep neural networks.
label: none

sentence: * The experimental results are interesting (although of modest scope) and support the hypothesis that the network is not counting the objects but rather is using an approximation that is sensitive to the ratio between the red and non-red items.
label: none

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: * The architecture of the particular model is described very briefly, and at multiple points there’s an implication that this is an investigation of “deep learning models” more generally, even though those models may vary widely.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: While the authors are using an existing model, they shouldn't assume that the reader has read the paper describing that model.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: I would like to see more discussion of whether it is at all plausible for this model to acquire the pairing strategy, compared to alternative VQA models (e.g., using relation networks).
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: * I found it difficult to follow the theoretical motivation for performing the work.
label: none

sentence: The goal seems to be to test whether the network is performing the task in way that "if not human-like, at least is cognitively plausible".
label: none

sentence: I don't understand what is meant by cognitively plausible but not human-like; perhaps an example of a cognitively implausible mechanism would help clarify this issue.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: Later in the same paragraph, the authors argue that "in the case of a human-centered domain like natural language, ultimately, some degree of comparability to human performance is indispensable".
label: none

sentence: This assertion is not justified, and seems surprising to me; we have very useful natural language processing systems that do not perform in a way that is comparable to humans (the hedge "some degree of" is really neither here nor there).
label: none

sentence: In general, I don't understand why we would want a visual question answering system that returns approximate answers --
label: none

sentence: isn't it better to have it count exactly how many red dots there are compared to non-red dots?
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: * The authors assume that explicit counting is not "likely to be learned by the 'one-glance' feed-forward-style neural network" evaluated in the paper. What is this statement based on? Why would a "one-glance" network have trouble counting objects?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: (What is a “one-glance network”?)
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: * Another vague concept that is used without clarification: it is argued that if the network implements something like the Approximate Number System, that shows that it can "learn and utilize higher-level concepts than mere pattern matching".
label: none

sentence: What is "pattern matching" and how does it differ from "higher-level concepts"?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: * Why would the pairing strategy in a neural network be affected by the clustering of the objects?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: I understand why a human who needs to saccade back and forth between the two groups of objects might lose track of the objects that have been paired so far, but I don't understand why that would affect the architecture in question.
label: none

sentence: Minor comments:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: * Is the definition of "most" really a central piece of evidence for "the apparent importance of a cardinality concept to human cognition"? Our ability to count seems sufficient to me. Perhaps I'm not understanding what the authors have in mind here.
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: * Please use the terms "interpretation" and "verification" consistently.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: * "One over the other strategy" -> "one strategy over the other".
label: arg-request_typo

sentence: * The paper is almost 9 pages long, but the contribution does not appear more substantial than a standard 8-page submission.
label: none

sentence: This paper presents a method for interactive agent modeling that involves learning to model a demonstrator agent not only through passively viewing the demonstrator agent, but also through interactions from a learner agent that learns to probe the environment of the demonstrator agent so as to maximally change the behavior of the demonstrator agent.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The approximated demonstrator agent is trained through standard imitation learning techniques and the learning or probing agent is trained using reinforcement learning.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The mind of the demonstrating agent is modeled as a latent space representation from a neural net.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: This latent space representation is used as the reinforcement learning signal for the learner (probing) agent similar to the curiosity driven techniques where larger changes in the representation of mind are sought out since they should lead to larger differences in demonstrator agent behavior.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors test this in several gridworld environments as well as a sorting task and show that their method achieves superior performance and generalizes better to unseen states and task variations compared to several baseline methods.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: General comments, in no particular order:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. The authors should provide more details on how the hand-crafted demonstrator agents were made.
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: I assume something similar to an a* algorithm was probably used for the passing task, but what about the maze navigation task?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 2. The demonstrated tasks are (gridworld and algorithmic) which are very simple RL taks with low-dimensional (non-visual) state-spaces
label: none

sentence: It's unclear how this would scale to more complex tasks with higher-dimensional state spaces such as Atari, Starcraft II or if this would work with tasks with continuous state and action spaces such as mujoco.
label: none

sentence: 3. The core premise behind training the learner agent with RL is using a curiosity driven approach to train a probing policy to incite new demonstrator behaviors by maximizing the differences between the latent vectors of the behavior trackers at different time steps.
label: none

sentence: Because the latent vector is modeled as a non-linear function, distances between latent vector representations do not necessarily correspond to similar distances between behavior policies (for example, KL distances between two policy distributions).
label: none

sentence: Since this is for ILCR, I think the authors should have taken a deeper dive into examining those latent representations and potentially visualizing those distances and how they correspond to different policy behaviors.
label: none

sentence: 4. The biggest flaw that I see in this method is the practicality of it's use.
label: none

sentence: This method relies on the ability to obtain or gain access to a demonstration agent to learn from.
label: none

sentence: In very simple tasks, such as the one presented here, the authors were able to hard-code their own demonstration agent.
label: none

sentence: However, in harder tasks, this will not be feasible.
label: none

sentence: If you are able to obtain or code your own agent, then you've already solved the task and there is no need to do any sort of imitation learning in the first place.
label: none

sentence: In reality, for sufficiently difficult tasks, a human would be the demonstration agent (as is done in most robotics tasks).
label: none

sentence: In practice, imitation learning from a human works well since the learning can be done offline (i.e., post-hoc after a set of demonstrations are collected from the human).
label: none

sentence: However, this task requires the learning to be interactive and thus the demonstrator needs to be present during the learning.
label: none

sentence: Interactively learning from a human becomes a problem if the learning takes tens of thousands of episodes of training since a human cannot reasonably be expected to be present for that amount of time.
label: none

sentence: Thus, the question is 1) how well will this method work with a human acting as the demonstrator? and 2) how can this method work if you are not able to have access to a demonstrator long periods of time (or even at all)?
label: arg-request_explanation

sentence: 5. My previous comment relates mainly to the application of improved imitation learning.
label: none

sentence: However, I do think this is still very useful in the context of multi-agent reinforcement learning for collaborative and competitive tasks (sections 4.6 and 4.7).
label: none

sentence: I think this method demonstrates a method for improved collaborative and/or competitive performances given the fact that you already have a single agent with a learned policy.
label: none

sentence: Overall, I think the paper presents a really nice idea of how to improve modeling of agents.
label: none

sentence: essentially, a learner agent learns how to probe a demonstrator agent to provide more information about what's being demonstrated and prevent over-fitting to a set of fixed demonstrations.
label: none

sentence: This work sounds novel to me from a reinforcement learning perspective, however, I'm not well versed on theory of mind research.
label: none

sentence: This paper investigates the impact of stale weights on the statistical efficiency and performance in a pipelined backpropagation scheme that maximizes accelerator utilization while keeping the memory overhead modest.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper proposes to combine pipelined and non-pipelined training in a hybrid scheme to address the issue of significant drop in accuracy when pipelining is deeper in the network.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The performance of the proposed pipelined backpropagation is demonstrated on 2 GPUs using ResNet with speedups of up to 1.8X over a 1-GPU baseline and a small drop in inference accuracy.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper is well written and easy to follow.
label: none

sentence: The proposed idea is interesting and its effectiveness is well demonstrated with a promising speed and a small drop in accuracy.
label: none

sentence: The proposed approach is compared to two existing works:  PipeDream [1] and GPipe [2].
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Though promising results have been demonstrated, a drawback of the proposed method is that it introduces more memory overhead compared to GPipe.
label: none

sentence: Although a detailed discussion is provided related to the memory consumption between the proposed method and PipeDream, no detailed discussion is provided with respect to GPipe.
label: none

sentence: Further, no proper convergence analysis of the proposed approach is provided and is desired due to the likely divergence in the optimization.
label: none

sentence: Minor comment: An interesting line of work is that of [3] which could be included in the discussion.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: Overall, the proposed approach is interesting and is shown to achieve promising results.
label: none

sentence: However, memory overhead is still an issue compared to existing method.
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes to enable GAN based TTS in the time domain with the careful designs of the (non-autoregressive) generator and discriminator.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: There have been various trials of GAN-TTS but not so many success and I'm glad to hear that the proposed method seems to enable GAN-TTS with fast inference thanks to the non-autoregressive property.
label: none

sentence: The method also proposes new objective measures inspired by the image recognition network based on the high-level features generated by end-to-end ASR, which is also another important contribution of this paper.
label: none

sentence: My concern for this paper is reproducibility.
label: none

sentence: Although I really appreciate the authors' efforts on providing implementational details in the appendix, the code and data do not seem to be publicly available, and I'm expecting that the implementation of this technique is relatively hard due to their complex designs of the generator and discriminator.
label: none

sentence: Apart from that, the paper is well written overall by well describing the trend of GAN studies in the image processing and the application of such image processing oriented GAN techniques to TTS.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose learnable "kaleidoscope matrices" (K-matrices) in place of manually engineered structured and sparse matrices.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: By capturing "all" structured matrices in a way that can be learned, and without imposing a specific structure or sparsity pattern, these K-matrices can improve on existing systems by
label: none

sentence: * capturing more structure (that was not handled by the existing manually engineered architecture),
label: none

sentence: * running faster than dense implementations.
label: none

sentence: The claim that "all" structured matrices can be represented efficiently is a strong one, and in section 2.3 the authors make it clear what they mean by this.
label: none

sentence: Although the proof is long and beyond the expertise of this reviewer, the basic explanation given in section 2.3 makes their point clear for the non-expert reader.
label: none

sentence: The balance of the paper empirically tests the claims of learnable structure and efficiency.
label: none

sentence: On the basis that these experiments essentially bear out the claims of the paper, I selected to accept the paper.
label: none

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: 1. Regarding the ISWLT translation task result:
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: With this dataset, it's a bit of a stretch to say there was "only a 1 point drop in BLEU score". That's a significant drop, and in fact the DynamicConv paper goes to significant lengths to make a smaller 0.8 point improvement.
label: none

sentence: There are probably many other ways to trade BLEU score for efficiency, and without showing those other methods (and the point drops they have), it's not clear that K-matrices are a good way to speed up decoding a bit.
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes a framework for learning interpretable latent representations for GANs.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The key idea is to use siamese networks with contrastive loss.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Specifically, it decomposes the latent code to a set of knobs (sub part of the latent code).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Each time it renders different images with different configurations of the knobs.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: For example, 1) as changing one knob while keeping the others, it expects it would only result in change of one attribute in the image, and 2) as keeping one knob while changing all the others, it expects it would result in large change of image appearances.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The relative magnitude of change for 1) and 2) justifies the use of a Siamese network in addition to the image discriminator in the standard GAN framework.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The paper further talks about how to use inductive bias to design the Siamese network so that it can control the semantic meaning of a particular knob.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: While I do like the idea, I think the paper is still in the early stage.
label: none

sentence: First of all, the paper does not include any numerical evaluation.
label: none

sentence: It only shows a couple of examples.
label: none

sentence: It is unclear how well the proposed method works in general.
label: none

sentence: In addition, the InfoGAN work is designed  for the same functionality.
label: none

sentence: The paper should compare the proposed work to the InfoGAN work both quantitatively and qualitatively to justify its novelty.
label: none

sentence: Summary
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: This paper describes a model for musical timbre transfer which builds on recent developments in domain- and style transfer.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The proposed method is designed to be many-to-many, and uses a single pair of encoders and decoders with additional conditioning inputs to select the source and target domains (timbres).
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The method is evaluated on a collection of individual note-level recordings from 12 instruments, grouped into four families which are used as domains.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The method is compared against the UNIT model under a variety of training conditions, and evaluated for within-domain reconstruction and transfer accuracy as measured by maximum mean discrepancy.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The proposed model seems to improve on the transfer accuracy, with a slight hit to reconstruction accuracy.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: Qualitative investigation demonstrates that the learned representation can approximate several coarse spectral descriptors of the target domains.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: High-level comments
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: Overall, this paper is well written, and the various design choices seem well-motivated.
label: none

sentence: The empirical comparisons to UNIT are reasonably thorough, though I would have preferred more in-depth evaluation of the MoVE model as well.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the authors introduced an extra input (control) to encode the pitch class and octave information during encoding.
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: I infer that this was necessary to achieve good performance, but it would be instructive to see the results without this additional input, since it does in a sense constitute a form of supervision, and therefore limits the types of training data which can be used.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: While I understand that quantifying performance in this application is difficult, I do find the results difficult to interpret.
label: none

sentence: Some of this comes down to incomplete definition of the metrics (see detailed comments below).
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: However, the more pressing issue is that evaluation is done either sample-wise within-domain (reconstruction), or distribution-wise across domains (transfer).
label: none

sentence: The transfer metrics (MMD and kNN) are opaque to the reader: for instance, in table 1, is a knn score of 43173 qualitatively different than 43180?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: What is the criteria for bolding here?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: It would be helpful if these scores could be calibrated in some way, e.g., with reference to
label: arg-request_result

sentence: MMD/KNN scores of random partitions of the target domain samples.
label: none

sentence: Since the authors do additional information here for each sample (notes), it would be possible to pair generated and real examples by instrument and note, rather than (in addition to) unsupervised, feature-space pairing by MMD.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: This could provide a slightly stronger version of the comparison in Figure 3, which shows that the overall distribution of spectral centroids is approximated by transfer, but does not demonstrate per-sample correspondence.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Detailed comments
label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: At several points in the manuscript, the authors refer to "invertible" representations (e.g., page 4, just after eq. 1), but it seems like what they mean is approximately invertible or decodable.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: It would be better if the authors were a little more careful in their use of terminology here.
label: arg-request_edit

sentence: In the definition of the RBF kernel (page 4), why is there a summation?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: What does this index? How are the kernel bandwidths defined?
label: arg-request_clarification

sentence: How exactly are reconstruction errors calculated: using the NSGT magnitude representation, or after resynthesis in the time domain?
label: arg-request_explanation

label: arg-structuring_heading

sentence: - The text is very well written, with a good balance between mathematical details and intuitions.
label: none

sentence: - I really like the high-level description of the algorithms and proof techniques
label: none

sentence: For the task of predicting interaction contact among atoms of protein complex consisting of two interacting proteins, the authors propose to train a Siamese convolutional neural network, noted as SASNet, and to use the contact map of two binding proteins’ native structure.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: The authors claim that the proposed method outperforms methods that use hand crafted features; also the authors claim that the proposed method has better transferability.
label: arg-structuring_summary

sentence: My overall concern is that the experiment result doesn’t really fully support the claim in the two aspects: 1) the SASNet takes the enriched dataset as input to the neural net but it also uses the complex (validation set) to train the optimal parameters, so strictly it doesn’t really fit in the “transfer” learning scenario.
label: none

sentence: Also, the compared methods don’t really use the validation set from the complex data for training at all.
label: none

sentence: Thus the experiment comparison is not really fair.
label: none

sentence: 2) The experiment results include standard errors for different replicates where such replicates correspond to different training random seeds (or different samples from the enriched set?), however, it doesn’t include any significance of the sampling.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the testing dataset is fixed.
label: none

sentence: A more rigorous setting is to, for N runs, each run splitting the validation and testing set differently.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Since this paper is an application paper, rather than a theoretical paper that bears theoretical findings, I would expect much more thorough experimental setup and analysis.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Currently it is still missing discussion such as, when SASNet would perform better and when it would perform worse, what it is that the state of the art features can’t capture while SASNet can.
label: none

sentence: Moreover, it is the prediction performance that matters to such task, but the authors remove the non-structure features from the compared methods.
label: none

sentence: Results and discussion about how the previous methods with full features perform compared to SASNet, and also how we can include those features into SASNet should complete the paper.
label: arg-request_experiment

sentence: Overall the paper is well written, and I do think the paper could be much stronger the issues above are addressed.
label: none
